intro: Murdannia zeylanica var. longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and lanceolate leaves that are usually arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
